meanings.definition: To copy or mimic someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She tried to immit her friend's dance moves.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to immit the style of a famous painter.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to immit the sound of the doorbell.
meanings.sent4: His impression of the teacher was so accurate, it seemed like he could immit her perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The actor's ability to immit different accents amazed the audience.

meanings.sent1: The machine can immit the same pattern over and over.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are trying to immit the conditions of the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The bakery managed to immit the taste of grandma's famous cookies.
meanings.sent4: The mirror seemed to immit every movement she made.
meanings.sent5: The printer can immit the exact colors of the original painting.

meanings.sent1: The virtual reality game can immit real-life scenarios.
meanings.sent2: The costume designer aimed to immit the look of a historical figure.
meanings.sent3: The robot's attempt to immit human emotions was both funny and endearing.
meanings.sent4: The new software can immit the handwriting of different users.
meanings.sent5: The wax figure was so well done, it could immit the celebrity's smile perfectly.
